alert.note: Alert for Iowa; Johnson; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 11 at 4:01PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Iowa, northwestern Washington and central Johnson Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 401 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wellman, or 17 miles northwest of Washington, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Iowa City, Coralville, Kalona, Wellman, University Heights, Hills, Oakdale, Iowa City Municipal Airport, Frytown, Windham, Johnson County Fairgrounds, Hills Access, Amish, West Overlook, University Of Iowa, Sharon Center, and Coralville Lake Dam Complex. This includes Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 241 and 248. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
